page.title: 04The Village of Skidby.
page.content: Skidby is a quiet and peaceful village. It is very tidy with numerous grass verges and trees. There are very few cars parked on the roadside. There are five farms along Main Street but most people work in Beverley or Hull. Skidby contains about 400 dwellings, which are a mixture of old houses which have been modernised and small areas of modern houses. Two cottages (18 and 20 Riplingham Road) are boarded up and two detached houses are being built in front of the school. There is a primary school for 60 children from the village and this has three teachers. Round the village green there is a small church, a Methodist chapel and a village hall. The village has a post office and a shop but most people shop outside the village.
